questions.question: If aware that a friend is being cyberbullied or harassed, or has experienced abuse, it is OK to keep the matter private
You can always know the exact identity of people with you whom you meet on internet.
It's Ok for an adult or older child to make you promise to keep a secret.
I f you see inappropriate images on internet, it is important to stop looking and tell a caring adult as soon as posible
Even if you have great security settings on your accounts, people can see the material you share because of your friends
The best policy is to refrain from posting personal/identifying information on internet.
It’s OK to say something online, if you wouldn't say it in person.
Once material is shared on the internet, the information can be easily deleted.
If unsure of whether an action is inappropriate, I should just keep quiet and not tell until I know for sure.
Private Parts: Those body parts covered by a bathing suit.
Your body is Sacred because it’s made as the same image and likeness of God.
Boundaries: The limits that define one person as separate from another or others.
What information should you keep to yourself when interacting with others or posting about yourself online?

choices.answer: My legal name and address information
The name of my favorite movie

questions.question: If someone I know online ask me to keep a secret from my family or others friends, what should I do?

choices.answer: Write a post online sharing the information with others
Talk to my parents about it
keep it a secret, because this person is a new friend

questions.question: When I've started to talk to someone online who I don't know in person...

choices.answer: I should be cautious, because I don’t actually know if this person is who
I should believe everything that they say to me
I don’t need to be cautious

questions.question: When is it OK to meet with someone you've only know online?

choices.answer: When you've exchanged enough secrets that you feel safe and confortable
When you've spoken to your parents and have developed a plan to safely
When they pressure of threaten you

questions.question: What is the right thing to do if someone threatens or bullies you or a friend of yours online?

choices.answer: Leave the device/situation, and tell a safe adult immediately
Take it upon yourself to respond back to bully
Act though and bully the person back
Don't tell anyone or do anything
Getting help for others when they aren't getting help for themselves
Refusing to join in bulling behavior
Using kind and appropriate language when communicating with others
